text: Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8> yes that’s what it’s looking like at present. For a public app it has to be extensible to read all properties (excluding calculated) in batches of line_items associated to the deal and create equivalent new line_item batches to associate to the quote. We can do it but it seems heavy handed versus a clone_object API call. <@U01QVR44MEY> you haven’t come across any undocumented cloning calls in your travels?

Hi all, I’m trying to push within the contact feed everytime there’s an email engagement (sent, open, click and reply) through an email sent via another tool (<http://lemlist.com|lemlist.com> in this case). I’ve been looking on the Engagement API doc and it seems not possible to create such record. Would someone know a trick by any chance? Thanks!

Hi, can I in the request - <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals>, transfer additional parameters other than those described here - <https://prnt.sc/BfF2cRdn1evY>?
• description 
• subtitle
maybe you can pass your own values there?
Yeah I have tried that, but it doesn’t send me back the validation rules when i look it up unfortunately :slightly_smiling_face:
if those properties are created you can send whatever properties you’d like
will this not work? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email>
if not i’d advise using notes as engagement activity there. i’m sure there are other work arounds as well
why don’t you host the is file where the website is?

i always try to do things the most efficient way but heavy handed seems a better way with a documented api call vs something that isn’t documented and not supported. 

one api pull, and a filter, then a create. hardly heavy handed.
oh ya this is the api where on the ducumentwtuin, in stead of clicking in example you click on schema and it displays all the data. that should help you!
True. At least for line_items they are typically pretty trim object without a lot of bloated extra properties and data

Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8> - When you say "default properties" would the `experience_id` and `event_property_desc` from my example above be considered default properties, or is there anything I need to do to declare default properties?
how do I create a new attribute - "description"? (view screenshot)

apologies, I’m out of office today without a laptop. In the create event UI it allows you to add custom properties and then there’s like 8, 16 or 20 default properties. I can’t remember the exact number. Those default properties automatically get added to the event and don’t need any type of markup inside the script piece.  those properties, off the top of my head, browser, IP address, etc. like the stuff the HubSpot tracking code typically picks up.  

so I use events a lot to record Calculator actions. We offer the ability for people to use calculators and whenever they click submit, we set up a couple properties like total price. Estimated number of people, like those form fields were using JavaScript to bring those form fields into our custom properties inside the event. those I had to create when I created the event, so those are the custom properties. does that help? apologies

You can create additional properties using the properties API, you’d have to create them on specific objects. You can also do that inside of HubSpot in the settings, properties, and then selecting the object and then creating/adding those properties there.

No worries, appreciate any response on this at all!

So it sounds like all the properties need to be "predefined" essentially? You can't just send in a random property value for the event each time without it already being defined.
Yeah unfortunately HubSpot really doesn't have a clone call type, it would be pretty cool though
If you have the body of the post request to create the original line items, you could just tweak it to associate with the deal instead of the quote (same exact request)
correct, no free form here at all
Hi all, I am trying to add a create date in HubDb using workflow custom code but the date output is different
You can provide an example or a link to the documentation
Hi, reviving this thread, any plan to allow us to access report data? I'm trying to automate a job to extract data from a report and delete notes that have matched the criteria of the report.
I haven't heard of any plan to do this yet, but you could possibly use the search api to setup the same filters and sorts as the report and then use the data returned for the delete

Hi all.
I am having trouble trying to use the *Import API* on the deal object. The import api goes through but nothing happens and the import error api returns a empty array. Does anyone have any insight on what the issue might be?
If I have companyID of 123456. and want to update a custom property named: stacey_property. with a value of 867. How can I do that single update?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties>

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> yes clone call would be handy and is worth a try. The Line Items already exist on the deal (from sales reps or cloned by HubSpot from a published quote) so we’ve now coded a cloner that reads the property schema to include custom props, ignores calculated props (there are ton in line items), then reads the deal’s line items and writes clones to the quote. An API cloner endpoint would be nice, but now it’s written it’ll be handy for other objects.
yeah 100%, definitely agree
if you're running 1000s of calls I would personally get the objects through the export api and then create and associate the objects using the imports api

Hi team, having issues with the call, I can't find what to use to replace `default_api`?
Trying to query the notes using filters. Have you had the same issue? How did you solve this?
Using POST*`/crm/v3/objects/notes/search`*
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/notes>

fixed, changed `default_api` for `search_api`
leaving it here for someone looking into it

The error I got was:
AttributeError: 'Discovery' object has no attribute 'default_api'

Hi all,
Is there a public API endpoint to get all the apps installed in a HubSpot account ?
Sorry was out during Thanksgiving. I’ve relayed this to the team, thank you for that.
no worries and thanks

do you guys know if an object owner id can be single digits? our app gathers the user’s owner id when it gets added, and updates the owner property to contacts or deals, but for one of our users that we just onboarded we got an owner ID of ‘6’. not sure if this should be a cause for concern

also curious about this, we tried to have a user add our app to their account and got this error. I’m assuming it’s because the user either doesn’t have permission to add apps to their account, or doesn’t have permissions for one of the scopes that our app requires? I haven’t seen this before. I tried removing all permissions from one of our internal user’s, taking away permissions to edit contacts, install marketplace OR dev apps, but that internal user was still able to add the app. any help would be greatly appreciated! hope you guys are doing well

maybe a good solution would be to only have the super admin of an account add the app, then use their access token to perform the functions we need to perform. But we need to get owner ID’s for all the users in their account to be able to assign that owner property on contacts/deals, and I’m not sure if we’ll be able to do that or get the owner ID for every user in the organization if we only have an access token for the super admin?

No one can see what your filters are filtering for. Can you explain what you are trying to get from api? Are you trying to get notes related to specific contacts or deals or you just trying to get all notes that contain a specific search string or something like that?
I haven’t looked, but I don’t think so

are you saving that ID as a number? That’s a possibility if they were leading zeros like 00006 if you were saving that as a number and you didn’t have it set up formatted in a way that it would resolve to just six by itself.

you can look up owners using the owners api. you can do that from any private app key as long as you have the proper scopes for it. Then you could easily understand who every owner is because you would have access to that.
<@U051F1U6C31> I’m having a similar issue… but even changing to search_api, my custom properties aren’t coming through. It seems like the documentation really needs updating…
I thought I am the one missing something. Thank you for the response.
ahhh makes sense. thank you Nicholas!
really appreciate this, makes sense

I just looked through HubSpot’s api response when we pinged them for the owner ID and it turns out the ID is actually single digit in some cases. in case anyone ever needs to look into this :slightly_smiling_face:
haha didn’t know that!
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>
